metadata.name: Potential Mpclient.DLL Sideloading Via Defender Binaries
metadata.comment: Detects potential sideloading of "mpclient.dll" by Windows Defender processes ("MpCmdRun" and "NisSrv") from their non-default directory.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\mpcmdrun.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\nissrv.exe'))) AND NOT (startswith(lower(process.name), lower('c:\\program files (x86)\\windows defender\\')) OR startswith(lower(process.name), lower('c:\\program files\\microsoft security client\\')) OR startswith(lower(process.name), lower('c:\\program files\\windows defender\\')) OR startswith(lower(process.name), lower('c:\\programdata\\microsoft\\windows defender\\platform\\')) OR startswith(lower(process.name), lower('c:\\windows\\winsxs\\'))))

output.summary: Detects potential sideloading of "mpclient.dll" by Windows Defender processes ("MpCmdRun" and "NisSrv") from their non-default directory.
